thread.title: Alexis Sanchez Will Only Sign New Arsenal Contract On One Condition
thread.title_full: Alexis Sanchez Will Only Sign New Arsenal Contract On One Condition

title: Alexis Sanchez Will Only Sign New Arsenal Contract On One Condition
text:
Alexis Sanchez Will Only Sign New Arsenal Contract On One Condition Tue Feb 07 2017 07:58:42   07:58:42 GMT+0000 (GMT) Joe Baiamonte Joe Baiamonte in football 
Alexis Sanchez's future at Arsenal has been up in the air all season, with rumours constantly circulating about the Chilean's contract demands at the Emirates Stadium. 
The former Barcelona forward has refused to commit his future to the Gunners, with both parties failing to come to an agreement on terms on a new deal for the 28-year-old. 
And now it appears Sanchez is going to stall talks on a new deal for even longer, by waiting until the end of the current season to discuss a contract extension. Credit: Sky Sports 
Sanchez, who has been linked with moves to Juventus, Chelsea, Manchester City and Paris Saint-Germain, wants to see which position the Gunners finish the 2016/17 Premier League season in before extending his stay in North London. PSG target Alexis Sanchez will wait to see Arsenal's final league position before deciding to extend his contract, according to @Tanziloic . - Get French Football (@GFFN) February 6, 2017 
Arsenal dropped down to fourth place following back-to-back defeats to Watford and Chelsea, last week, all but ending what was left of a title challenge. With Bayern Munich awaiting Arsene Wenger's men in the last 16 of the Champions League, advancement in Europe is also looking like a big ask for a team that have failed to make the quarter-finals for the last seven years. We may not be seeing Alexis in an Arsenal shirt much longer. Image: PA 
It is believed that, were Arsenal forced to sell Sanchez, who arrived at the Emirates from Barcelona in 2014 in a Â£32m deal, that they would prefer to sell him to a foreign team instead of a domestic rival, putting Juventus and PSG ahead of Chelsea and Manchester City in the queue for the Chilean's signature.
